intro: Obione sturtii, commonly known as the Sturt's obione, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Obione sturtii is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
